alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 25 at 8:24PM MST until July 25 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM MST FOR PINAL COUNTY... At 824 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 11 miles west of Chui-Chu to 7 miles south of Superior, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 178 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 152 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 209 and 215. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Florence, Coolidge, Arizona City, La Palma, Blackwater, Toltec, Magma, San Tan Valley, Coolidge Airport, Florence Junction, Arizola, San Tan Mountain Park, Randolph and Queen Valley. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
